Comment: I agree nukes led to it, but our rules of engagement changed, we hold ourselves to a different set of rules than our opponents. It hasn't become about winning the war, it has become not being seen as bad. Our enemies don't have that hangup.   So it is essentially impossible to win a war when that is the mindset.
Author: Dead-as-a-Doornail

Comment: They aren't, but every culture has a point. With Japan, it took proof we could instantaneously vaporizer an entire city in a single moment. Even then it took us doing it twice before they came to the table.    The development of precision guided munitions and associated rules of war really just made it so wars aren't winnable anymore. Maybe that was the point. But it removed a big sense of fear from the general population and it seems that fear is what led to actual conflict resolution and peace.    What Israel is doing in Gaza will serve as another good case study. I think they're motivated by a similar understanding.
Author: Material-Afternoon16
